quest.name: Thick Skin
journal: With the formalities now out of the way, Nonowato would have you do some mining.

Nonowato informs you that he has at last finished compiling his long list of minerals. He proceeds to tease you with the exciting prospect of actual work, before noting that Stickqix wishes to brief you himself first. To that end, Nonowato leads you in the direction of the Bangpots.

Regrettably, Stickqix's hands are full with other matters and he is unable to give you anything approaching an adequate briefing. You discover that his two Roegadyn workers are in the midst of a spat, bringing work on the Gobroller to a total standstill. Stickqix sheepishly asks if you would not mind intervening on his behalf to help solve the dispute.

You patiently listen to each worker's gripes and soon discover the cause of the dispute. Krystrymm is of the opinion that the vehicle needs to be outfitted with sturdy armor built to withstand physical attacks. Fohcwyda, on the other hand, believes that magic is the greatest threat to the Gobroller and would see it fitted with the appropriate protection. You go over what you have heard and ready yourself to give a summary to Stickqix.

You explain to Stickqix just why his workers are butting heads. He remarks that he may have an idea as to how this dispute can be resolved, but says it will require a certain mineral. The chief asks you to mine twenty chunks of beggar's mythril ore from the Striped Hills in Gyr Abania.

Stickqix uses the minerals you procured on his behalf to create an ingot, which he shows to Krystrymm and Fohcwyda. The two of them are tasked with using this metal to create armor resistant to both magical and physical attacks. The fight finished, you choose to join Nonowato outside to discuss future work.

Nonowato unreservedly apologizes for the actions of his colleagues and encourages you to rest up well before your help is required again. You decide to follow his advice while continuing to hone your mining skills on the side.

※The next miner quest will be available from Nonowato upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Mine beggar's mythril ore on the Striped HillsDeliver the chunks of beggar's mythril ore to Stickqix.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Truly, your timing is impeccable. I finished writing up the list of minerals not a few moments ago!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I would love to hand it over to you, but Chief Stickqix said he was keen to see that you were properly briefed first. Please follow me to the Bangpots!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename! I, um, there's been a slight complication, you see. I think the chief is best placed to explain things to you!

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: All I can say is I'm glad most Roegadyn women don't have heads as hard as Fohcwyda's!

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: Feels like things are heating up in here! Or is that just the molten metal behind me?

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: Honestly, has anyone actually checked that Krystrymm isn't all brawn and no brains?

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Addlebrained workers give Stackblox the shiveryshakes! Stackblox needs quiet to do good sweatworking.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... You have my thanks for coming. Regrettably, it is not the best of times─pray wait a moment.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Or mayhap you, as an outsider, would be best suited to solve this conundrum. I know this is not quite what we requested your services for, but would you mind granting us your succor, old girlold boy?

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Originally, I had planned to ask that you mine materials required for the construction of the Gobroller's armor. However, work has come to a screeching halt thanks to Krystrymm and Fohcwyda deciding that their time would be better served arguing.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: But something tells me that you might just be the one to make them see eye to eye once more! I would be eternally grateful if you could speak with them and unearth the cause of this fissure.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... I am ever in your debt, noble miner.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: The rest I leave up to you. You have my full confidence!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Pray speak to Krystrymm and Fohcwyda and find out just what has gotten them so agitated.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text:
My sincerest apologies, Forename! Our team are incredibly stu—strong-willed.
...Rather stubbornly so.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. What's that? You've heard that Fohcwyda and I haven't been on the best of terms lately? Well, I suppose that's one way of putting it.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: We'll be using the Gobroller in the Dravanian hinterlands, an area rife with all kinds of vile beasts. And what do vile beasts do? They attack. Ferociously.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: Ask anyone in Idyllshire and they'd tell you the machine needs heavy armor capable of withstanding physical attacks. Anyone except Fohcwyda anyway. She's gotten it into her head for some bloody reason that claws and fangs don't warrant fortified defenses.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: Absolutely no clue how the chief expects me to work with someone who, never mind the forest, can't even see the trees surrounded by monsters in the hinterlands!

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: If you are here about a certain quarrel then you may as well just leave now. I would not expect a miner to understand the complexities of armor design.

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: That being said, it is hardly a complicated matter. My point is simple: we need to equip the Gobroller with ample protection against magic. That loggerhead simply needs to acquiesce and we can resume our work once more.

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: As I am sure you have noted during your adventures, these lands have their fair share of fantastic beasts that wield deadly magic. This is precisely why I am of the mind that we need to ensure our machine is protected against such threats! How can he think otherwise?

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text:
Ah, but I forget myself. His lack of sense infuriates me so.
In summary, I have no intention whatsoever of changing to suit Krystrymm's ridiculous ideas.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: I can't work with anyone who doesn't respect the importance of sturdy defenses. I just don't have it in me.

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: To hear him speak you would think he had never borne witness to the destructive powers of magic!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... So that was the cause of this commotion? You have my thanks, Forename.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: However, I must say I am truly perplexed by all of this. Neither one of them is entirely in the wrong after all... Nonowato, dear boy, a gil for your thoughts.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: M-My thoughts? Well, as you say, they're both quite good ideas! If only there was some way we could have our cake and eat it...

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Cake? You have strayed awfully far from the subject, but I am inclined to believe there is a way we can combine these two approaches. That is the founding principle behind our work after all─making the impossible possible!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Forename, would it trouble you to mine some beggar's mythril ore for me? Twenty chunks or so should be enough.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: As to what we actually need it for...well, let's save that surprise for your triumphant return!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: According to Sharlayan records, beggar's mythril ore can be found in the fringes of Gyr Abania. The best of luck!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Forename, as the chief said, we require twenty chunks of beggar's mythril ore. You should be able to find the mineral on the Striped Hills in Gyr Abania.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Was your trip a success?

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: You really outdid yourself on this one, old girlold boy! The quality leaves nothing to be desired. Nonowato, fetch Krystrymm and Fohcwyda for me.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: Chief, would you mind explaining just why Fohcwyda's here as well? I figured you were well aware of the bad blood between us.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Never mind your silly squabbles, take a look at this!

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: What am I looking at exactly?

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... 'Tis an alloy I created using the beggar's mythril ore that I had Forename mine for us. It is noteworthy for having exceedingly low aetherial conductivity.

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: You mean to say that you are going to use my idea? Fantastic!

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: Chief, how could you!? You may as well tie the Gobroller up in a neat little bow and gift it to the beasts at this rate!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Now, now, let's not jump to any rash conclusions here, you two. Imagine this: we make sheet metal using this ingot, proceeding to wrap it in the regular sheet metal we use for vehicle armor.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: That's all very well and good as an idea, but in practice, that's going to weigh the vehicle down to no end!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: I would not be so sure. If you combine your skills, there is no reason that the impossible need remain so. Stacking the two types of metal to create a new kind of armor—one which fulfills all our needs—is something I imagine you two are quite capable of doing. Would you not agree, Forename?

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: ...Hmph.

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: I can tell you now, we are going to need to do more than just jam two bits of metal together! Creating armor that is resistant to all kinds of attacks whilst also being of a manageable weight and size...well, it is much easier said than done.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: We could try welding the two types of sheet metal together...although, we'd still need to figure out a way of reducing the thickness of the armor to a single sheet. Doesn't look like we'll have much time for fighting with this on our plate, eh, Fohcwyda?

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: I could not have put it better myself! If we both have the energy to bicker, then we certainly have the energy to develop a new way of creating armor. Let us not give the chief cause to regret his words, Krystrymm!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: By the gods, it worked! Chief, you're brilliant!

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... I could not have done it without the help of our darling miner friend! Once more, I am indebted to you, old girlold boy.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: You have my thanks as well! Pray join me outside so that we may review today's developments and discuss your future schedule.

dialogue.name: STICKQIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... A hearty thanks for all your help thus far. But know this: the work has only just begun!

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: Apologies for involving you in our little spat, Forename. You have my word that the minerals you brought us will not go to waste!

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: I can only apologize profusely for wasting your time with our frivolous fight. I shall put twice the energy into developing this armor! I imagine you will be quite impressed with what we create.

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: The fighting has ceased, but my sweating has not. No rest for the wicked, I suppose.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Stackblox's sweatwork is at its most critical stage! Gobbie has no time for uplander arguments.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: You did amazing work today, Forename! Allow me to thank you once more.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: However, I also feel rather obligated to apologize for asking so much of you—I don't imagine you expected to have to mediate between our workers when you accepted this job. I'd love to say this was the first time such a quarrel has erupted between those two...

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: But that's neither here nor there! Enjoy some well-earned rest and seek me out once more when you feel ready for your next job.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To be deleted.
